quiz.title: State diagnosis
quiz.progressNote: Answer honestly to see your state more clearly.

results.interpretationNote: This interpretation is indicative only and does not replace professional help. Keep your result to discuss it with a specialist if needed.
results.ctaDescription: Make time for rest and track your state gently. Recall which practices once helped you recover and return to them step by step.

tips.title: Tips
items: Take short breaks without feeling guilty.
Discuss workload and limits with people you trust.
Seek support if heavy emotions persist.

levelDescriptions.mild: You are in the zone of gentle fatigue. Give yourself regular rest and review your load before tension grows.
levelDescriptions.moderate: Unresolved tension is piling up. Slow down, redistribute obligations, and add more self-care rituals.
levelDescriptions.high: The exhaustion level is clearly high. Consider professional support and a patient review of priorities to regain energy.
levelDescriptions.critical: Mind and body signal a limit. Pause, ask for specialist help, and build a support system step by step.

q1.text: How often do you wake up without a sense of purpose for the day ahead?

options.d: Nearly every morning

q2.text: How strongly do you feel that emotions have faded and reactions became mechanical?

options.d: I live in this state constantly

q3.text: How do you react to the idea of starting a new project?

options.c: I avoid it, no energy left
options.d: I reject it automatically, it’s draining

q4.text: Do you feel your duties drain you faster than you can recover?

options.a: No, I keep a good pace
options.c: Most of the time I squeeze myself dry
options.d: I’m constantly on the edge of exhaustion

q5.text: How hard is it to acknowledge your needs and ask for support?

options.d: I avoid it completely

q6.text: How often do you want to disconnect from all communication?

options.d: I avoid people almost always

q7.text: How hard is it to enjoy even good news?

options.b: I feel less joy than I’d like
options.d: I don’t feel joy at all

q8.text: Do you feel you play the role of a strong person instead of being authentic?

options.b: Sometimes I must keep a brave face
options.c: That role turned into a habit
options.d: I no longer know who I am without it

q9.text: How often do you avoid new experiences because you lack energy?

options.c: New things tire me almost always
options.d: I completely gave up on the new

q10.text: How often do you feel body and mind move in a tired autopilot?

options.c: Almost every day I live on auto
options.d: I constantly feel inner numbness

q11.text: How do you respond when loved ones ask to spend time together?

options.b: I agree but without much enthusiasm
options.d: I nearly always avoid such requests

q12.text: How much meaning have your work or projects lost?

options.c: Meaning slips away more than it stays
options.d: I see no value in what I do

q13.text: How often do you notice irritation bursts without a clear reason?

options.d: I live in a state of hidden anger

q14.text: How freely do you allow restorative rest without guilt?

options.b: Sometimes I feel guilty for breaks
options.d: I don’t let myself rest

q15.text: How often do you want to disappear from your usual environment for a while?

options.b: Sometimes I dream of a short break
options.d: I constantly want to disappear

q16.text: How strongly do you feel emotional emptiness in relationships and within yourself?

options.b: At times I sense the cold
options.c: Emptiness turned into a usual background
options.d: It feels like I’m disconnected from emotions

q17.text: How much do you doubt that you can feel joy again?

options.d: I’m sure joy is unreachable

q18.text: How hard is it to name at least one thing that inspires you?

options.d: Nothing feels inspiring

q19.text: How often do you feel it’s easier to support others than ask for help yourself?

options.c: I almost never ask for support
options.d: I completely stopped asking

q20.text: How often do memories of past hobbies bring sadness instead of joy?

options.a: They almost always make me smile
options.b: Sometimes I feel a gentle sadness
options.c: Sadness appears more often than joy
options.d: These memories are poisoned by melancholy

q21.text: How tired are you of maintaining an image of control and confidence?

options.b: Sometimes I need to pull myself together
options.c: Mostly I hold on by a thread
options.d: I’m completely drained by this role

q22.text: How hard is it to slow down and listen to your emotions?

options.a: I check in with myself regularly
options.d: I’ve completely lost touch with emotions

q23.text: How often do you feel you live someone else's life?

options.b: Sometimes I feel off my path
options.d: I’m sure I live not my life

q24.text: How much do you believe you can restore interest in the future?

options.b: Hope is still there, though fragile
options.c: Faith hangs by a thin thread
options.d: I see no chance to regain interest
